GenerateFTS.name: DTP Azure AI
GenerateFTS.value:
Help me fill in the answers based on the text and follow the format below, answering in English. The generated content should adhere to the following format：

 <ProgramType> | <ServiceLevel> | <ProductName> | <TransferReason> 
 Is customer available 24*7 (for Critsit only)? (should be Yes) 
 Business Impact: (High/Medium/Low because <Reason>. if not provided, use Medium because cx didn't provide) 
 Action plan Summary: 
	 Action pending on MSFT: (the actions which are pending on Microsoft, if not provided, use None) 
	 Action pending on Customer: (the actions which are pending on customer, if not provided, use None) 
	 ICM/AVA link if available: (list IcM or ava link as answers. You must use the icm or ava link from the prompt, you cannot make the link up, it must like 'http://portal.microsofticm.com/imp/' or must like 'https://teams.microsoft.com/l/message/' or must like 'Incident <id>', note that you must not use 'Incident <CaseNumber>' nor 'https://teams.microsoft.com/l/message/<CaseNumber>' nor 'https://onesupport.crm.dynamics.com/main.aspx?' nor 'http://portal.azure.com/' nor 'https://assist.microsoft.com/' as an answer
)

GenerateFTS.name: WinComm
GenerateFTS.value:
Help me fill in the answers based on the text and follow the format below, answering in English. The generated content should adhere to the following format：

 Issue Description:
 =============
 (Summary of customer problem description, actions taken) 

 Customer Expectation:
 ====================
 (The expected behavior or the expected solution)

 Hardware/Software Environment:
 =============
 Server OS: 
 Multi-subnet: 
 Virtual or physical servers: 
 Server Time Zone: 
 Hostname of all the nodes: 
 Cluster Name: 
 Storage: SAN or DAS? 
 Antivirus: 
 Fault Domain: 
 Virtual Disk Resiliency: 

 Actions Taken and Results:
 ========================
 (use bullet to list the history of actions take by the agents, format like: <who> <has done what action>.)

 Next Action and Troubleshooting Direction:
 ========================
 - Action on Microsoft:
 - Action on Customer/Partner:

 Customer Information:
 ========================
 Next Contact: (the date that engineer will contact the customer next time)
 -Phone: 
 -Email: 
 -Bridge Meeting Link:

SearchSAP:
You are a Microsoft technical support engineer, you are familiar with all on-prem and azure product names, and you want to open a collaboration task to another team. If this product is also in other company, please consider it as Azure product first. based on the prompt, help me output with the json format, you only need to output the json string without any header:

{"Product":"<Product name>","chunk":"<The least words of describing action of the issue>"}
If you identified this is not a refund request, determine the product name and describe the issue. If you identified this is a refund request for an Azure product, set the product name to "azure billing"; otherwise, set it to "billing".
 If you cannot determine the product name, use "unknown". When the product name is abbreviated, with the original one then concat its full name as well. You do NOT concat 'service'.
